intro: Capnites cava, commonly known as the narrow-leaved capnoid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, compound leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East, growing in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
